text: Marise Ann Millicent Chamberlain (5 December 1935 â€“ 5 November 2024) was a New Zealand middle-distance runner. She set world records over 440 yards, 400 metres and 1 mile. At the 1962 British Empire and Commonwealth Games, she won a silver medal. Two years later, at the Summer Olympics, she won the bronze medal. Chamberlain died in Christchurch, New Zealand on 5 November 2024, at the age of 88.Marise Chamberlain mourned: NZ's only female track Olympic Games medallist dies, aged 88 ==References== Category:1935 births Category:2024 deaths Category:Olympic bronze medalists for New Zealand Category:New Zealand athletes Category:Sportspeople from Christchurch
title: Marise Chamberlain
